title: Shrub Identification
description: Shrubs form the backbone of many gardens! Test your knowledge of popular flowering and evergreen shrubs.

questions.question: Which flowering shrub is famous for large globe-shaped flower clusters that can be blue, pink, or white depending on soil pH?
What evergreen shrub is traditionally shaped into formal hedges and topiaries in English gardens?
Which fragrant shrub blooms in clusters of purple, white, or pink flowers in late spring?
What deciduous shrub is one of the first to bloom in early spring with bright yellow flowers on bare branches?
Which evergreen shrub produces red berries and is commonly associated with Christmas decorations?
What flowering shrub is closely related to rhododendrons but is typically smaller with funnel-shaped flowers?
Which shrub is known as the "Butterfly Bush" because its flower spikes attract many butterflies?
What thorny shrub produces orange berries in dense clusters and is often used as a security hedge?
Which elegant shrub has waxy, camellia-like flowers and glossy evergreen leaves, blooming in winter?
What shrub is known for its aromatic, silver-green foliage and is commonly used in French and Mediterranean cooking?
Which native North American shrub produces edible blue berries and beautiful fall foliage?
What evergreen shrub has needle-like foliage, produces blue berry-like cones, and is used to flavor gin?
Which deciduous shrub has arching branches covered in small pink or white flower clusters in spring?
What shrub is known for its intensely fragrant white flowers and is a popular choice for Southern gardens?
Which large shrub or small tree blooms in summer with crepe-textured flowers in pink, red, purple, or white?
